treatment.reference: Methanogenium, a New Genus of Marine Methanogenic Bacteria, and Characterization of Methanogenium cariaci sp. nov. and Methanogenium marisnigri sp. nov. Arch Microbiol 121:147-153
treatment.description: Highly irregular cocci; cell width 2.6 µm. Cells are peritrichously flagellated and have pili. Gram nagative; sensitive to 1% SDS. Cell wall has a periodic surface pattern. Colony characteristics: Circular, umbonate, greenish-yellow with entire edges and a shiny surface. DNA base composition: 52 mol % G + C. Temperature optimum 20 – 25˚C. pH optimum 6.8 to 7.3. Isolated from sediment from Cariaco Trench. Fastidious anaerobe; formate or H2-CO2 serve as substrates for growth and methane production; acetate and methanol do not. Optimal growth in 0.54 M Na+; yeast extract and acetate required for growth. Type strain: JR1. DSM number 1497 Gottingen, FRG.
